reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: British Council - Peru - Newton Fund

description.narrative: The Newton Fund uses science and innovation partnerships to promote economic development and social welfare of partner countries.

The Newton Fund's primary objective is to reduce poverty by generating and putting into use knowledge and technology to address development challenges and advance development for the poorest people and countries. We will seek to maximise the practical impact of research and innovation to improve the lives and opportunities of the global poor. In achieving this we will grow the research and innovation capacity of developing countries, as well as contributing to the continued strength of the UK’s research and innovation system, and support our wider prosperity and global influence.

reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: LATAM Regional Biodiversity call (2017)

description.narrative: Travel grants for researchers to build capacity and support research in priority areas and workshops on biodiversity among researchers from Latam countries and UK.

To improve scientific capacity and networks in Latin American biodiversity - and address specific development needs of the region.
4 workshops, each with 20 researchers from the UK and 20 from partner countries. 4 travel grants per participant country for early career researchers.

title.narrative: Researcher Links Workshops (2017)

description.narrative: Joint workshops on priority research areas, with a focus on building capacity of early career researchers.

To build sustainable research links between the UK and Peru and build capacity for engagement in international research collaboration in areas that are relevant to economic development and social welfare. 4 workshops in the current call, each with 20 researchers from the UK and 20 from Peru

title.narrative: Professional Development and Enagagement (PDE) (2017)

description.narrative: Professional development programme for policy makers on Science Technology and Innovation (STI) management. SDGs: 8,9,10,17

To train and increase capacity of a cohort of professionals in public Science Technology and Innovation (STI) policy making, capable to design and execute effective policies for improving the country economy and well-being through science and technology. PHASE 1 : It has two components. Component I is training workshop executed in March 2017 . Component II was a study visit for 14 policy makers and CTI government managers, to UK that took place in November 2018

title.narrative: Institutional Links (2018)

description.narrative: Grants for research and innovation collaborations between the UK and partner countries to support the translation of research into benefit.

To initiate new research and innovation collaborations between academic groups, departments and institutions in partner countries and the UK and support the exchange of research and innovation expertise and the translation of research knowledge into tangible benefits.

title.narrative: Professional Development and Enagagement (PDE) Workshop on capacity building for policy makers

description.narrative: Professional development programme for policy makers on Science, Technlology and Innovation (STI) management.

To design and develop a roadmap to strengthen the governance of the Science Technology and Innovation (STI) ecosystem in Peru and the role of rector / leadership of CONCYTEC PHASE 1 : Component II.2 workshop for central government CTI officials (8 ministries) and 7 regions (regional governments, academia, Chambers of Commerce). February 2019

reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: Professional Development and Engagement (PDE) – 2019 - research management and governance - Phase II Capacity Building to Science Technology and Innovation (STI) directors and managers in regions

description.narrative: Professional development programme for policy makers and managers on Science Technology and Innovation (STI) with focus on the regions. management.,

It aims to strengthen the skills of Science Technology and Innovation (STI) managers in regions directly involved in STI operations to enable them to direct and move forward the territorial industrial agenda. Participating regions will be the same ones that took part in the 2019 February workshop on governance: Piura, Cajamarca, Moquegua, Cuzco, La Libertad, San Martin, Tacna.

title.narrative: Professional Development and Engagement (PDE) - 2019 - research translation – Creation of a Scientific Advisory group

description.narrative: This programme will seek to provide technical assistance for the design of a Scientific Consulting Unit of advisors.
It will provide intelligence and scientific advice to institutions responsible for public policy and technological transfer-absorption to the private sector.

title.narrative: Professional Development and Engagement (PDE) – 2019 - research translation -Technical Assistance Innovation Pillar

description.narrative: Design of a methodology for the identification of the gap in highly qualified human capital for prioritized sectors and the development of a pilot experience in a region

A project that aims to develop a methodology in regions can identify and address human capital gaps in key sectors to strengthen territorial productive transformation with equity promoted by the National Policy in Competitiveness and Productivity

title.narrative: Professional Development and Engagement (PDE) – 2019 - research translation -Technical Assistance Botanical Garden

description.narrative: Diagnostic that supports a future feasibility study to explore all aspects of the creation of a National Botanical Garden,.

Aims to analise its purpose in the country context , structure and funding requirements . Should be based on extensive investigation and research to support the process of decision making.External expertise will be required, due to scale and complexity.
